English (United States)(en-US): Today I went to what\nhumans call a “party.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나, 오늘은 인간들이 ‘파티’라고\n부르는 곳에 다녀왔어.

English (United States)(en-US): A party! Must have been fun, huh?|Ugh. Not really a fan of noisy places...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 파티라니! 즐거웠겠네?|윽, 시끄러운 곳은 질색이지만...

English (United States)(en-US): It must have been packed with humans. You love humans.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치가 좋아하는 인간들이 잔뜩 모인 장소잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): But maybe you had a great time\nas a social monster?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 혹시 뭉치는 사교적인 괴물이\n되어 즐거운 경험을 하고 온 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): It was nice to see humans all dressed up.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 화려하게 치장한 인간들을 구경하는 건 즐거웠어.

English (United States)(en-US): I heard the thumping beat\nand the thunderous applause.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 박자가 튀는 노래가 들리고 쏟아지는 갈채가 보였지.

English (United States)(en-US): And... and everybody looked happy.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 또... 또... 자리에 모인 모두가 행복해 보였어.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m glad you sensed my next\nwords would start with a “but.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 내 다음 말이 ‘하지만’일 거라\n맞혀 준 것이 정말로 기뻐.

English (United States)(en-US): I wanted to be happy\nwith them. But I was too...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다만 끔찍하게도... 내가 그 기쁨을 맛보기엔 너무...

English (United States)(en-US): Too...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너무도...

English (United States)(en-US): ....... Oh dear. ‘It’s hard to breathe.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ....... 이런. ‘숨이 잘 쉬어지지 않아’.

English (United States)(en-US): (Should I take Dot to a vet?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (동물 병원에라도 데려가야 하나?)

English (United States)(en-US): My gooey insides are\nswirling in a vacuum of chaos.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 몸속 모든 점액질이 진공 상태의\n혼돈 속에서 소용돌이치는 기분이야.

English (United States)(en-US): (No vet in the world is qualified to\ntreat gooey monsters! What now?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (점액질 괴물의 신체에 대해 아는\n동물 병원이 있을 리가 없잖아! 어쩌지?)

English (United States)(en-US): What happened at the party?\nYou weren’t hurt, were you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 대체 파티에서 어떤 일이 일어났던 거야?\n다치기라도 한 건 아니지?

English (United States)(en-US): Hurt....
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다치다....

English (United States)(en-US): Hurt. But the red-headed girl is now\ntoo far away for anything to hurt her.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다치다. 빨간 머리의 소녀는\n다칠 기회조차 빼앗겼는걸.

English (United States)(en-US): I never saw a scene so glittering,\ndizzying, and utterly cold-blooded.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 반짝거리고, 혼란스럽고,\n비정한 광경은 처음이었어.

English (United States)(en-US): ... I couldn’t wrap my\nsmall head around it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 나의 작은 머리로는\n도저히 납득할 수가 없을 정도로.

English (United States)(en-US): ... Did she know?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 그녀는 알았을까?

English (United States)(en-US): That on an absolutely normal day,\nwhile waltzing to a 80s hit track
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 여느 때와 다름없는 하루에, 여느 때와 다름없이\n80년대 명반에 맞춰 왈츠를 추던 찰나

English (United States)(en-US): she would swallow a ‘lucky coin’\nwith her forkful of frosted cake?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 포크로 갓 뜬 생크림케이크와 함께\n그만 ‘행운의 동전’을 삼켜 버리게 될 줄?

English (United States)(en-US): Did she know the human body was\nincapable of withstanding such luck,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간의 신체가 그만 한 행운을 견디기엔\n지나치게 유약하고 정교하게 설계되어 있던 탓에

English (United States)(en-US): that she would die just like that?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그대로 죽어 버리게 될 줄?

English (United States)(en-US): Did she have even an inkling of\nhow pointless her end would be?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 자신의 허망한 끝에 대하여, 그녀는\n가늠이나 제대로 할 수 있었을까?

English (United States)(en-US): No one... could have seen it coming.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 누구도... 그런 걸 예상하진 못했을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): She must have gotten up like any other\nmorning, stretched and yawned,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그녀는 여느 아침처럼 일어나자마자 자리를\n박차고, 팔을 벌려 스트레칭을 한 다음

English (United States)(en-US): humming while thinking of the party\nshe would attend that evening.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 저녁에 있을 ‘파티’를 떠올리며\n콧노래를 부르거나 시를 읊었을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe she had plans after the party as well,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 집에 돌아와선 어쩌면 피곤할 테니

English (United States)(en-US): like picking up Alice in Wonderland or\nHeidi of the Alps<\i> before going to bed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <이상한 나라의 앨리스>나 <알프스 산의 하이디>를\n펼쳐 들어야지, 라고 다짐하면서...

English (United States)(en-US): Because... why wouldn’t life go on?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모든 인간이 그러듯이 당연하게 다음을 기약했겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): You thought a lot about that girl.|She was so young... how tragic.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 소녀에 대해 많은 생각을 했구나.|세상에... 아직 어린 소녀에게 그런 비극이...

English (United States)(en-US): I would have froze too. To see that girl\nfall to the ground and stay there…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나였어도 얼어붙었을 것 같아. 발랄하게 춤을 추던 소녀가 갑자기 쓰러져 일어나지 않았다면......

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t know if this helps...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 도움이 될진 모르겠지만...

English (United States)(en-US): But I’ve witnessed death too.|It’s only natural. It was your first time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 실은 나도 죽음의 순간을 목격한 적 있어.|죽음을 처음 접하면 충격을 받는 게 당연해.

English (United States)(en-US): Warm blood once circulated that body.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 분명 따뜻한 피가 흐르며 생기가 돌던 ‘사람’이었는데.

English (United States)(en-US): But once life drained away, all that\nwas left was a shapeless, nameless void.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 생명이 빠져 나간 자리는 차게 식어 있었고,\n형용할 수 없는 공허함만이 남아 있었지.

English (United States)(en-US): Was there really anything left in there?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니, 그걸 ‘남았다’고 표현할 수 있었을까?

English (United States)(en-US): I just couldn’t look away.|I just couldn’t shake the image.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 어째서인지 눈을 뗄 수 없었어.|... 어째서인지 그 잔상을 떨쳐 낼 수 없었어.

English (United States)(en-US): Thank you for sharing your memory.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 경험을 공유해 주어 고마워.

English (United States)(en-US): You couldn’t look away...\nYou couldn’t look away.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 눈을 뗄 수 없었다... 눈을 뗄 수 없었다.

English (United States)(en-US): I know how you felt. I couldn’t either.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러게, 나 역시 그녀에게서\n눈을 뗄 수 없었던 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Thank you for sharing your experience.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 경험을 공유해 주어 고마워.

English (United States)(en-US): You couldn’t shake the image...\nYou couldn’t shake the image.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잔상을 떨쳐 낼 수 없었다... 잔상을 떨쳐 낼 수 없었다

English (United States)(en-US): I know how you felt. I couldn’t either.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러게, 나 역시 그녀의 잔상을\n떨쳐 낼 수 없었던 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Not once I saw ‘it’.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘그것’을 봐 버렸거든.

English (United States)(en-US): It?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그것?

English (United States)(en-US): ... The coin.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 동전의 뒷면.

English (United States)(en-US): Or rather, the other side of it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 동전의 뒷면을 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Death has stayed by us since the dawn of time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음은 기억할 수도 없을 정도로 오랫동안 우리 곁에\n있어 왔지만...

English (United States)(en-US): But trying to comprehend it can be scary.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 막상 이해해 보려 들면 까마득하고 무섭게 느껴지거든.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s why we observe death through books and movies.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래서 우리는 책이나 영화 같은 이야기를 통해\n죽음을 미리 들여다보기도 하지.

English (United States)(en-US): It gives us a glimpse into how it\nmakes one feel, or what it’s truly like.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음의 감정을 엿보거나, 그 실체를\n어느 정도 가늠해 볼 수 있으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): But you had to face death without any\nkind of warning. Of course it shook you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치는 어떠한 준비도 없이 무방비하게\n죽음을 마주하게 됐잖아. 놀라는 게 당연해.

English (United States)(en-US): Thank you for sharing your wisdom.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 지혜를 공유해 주어 고마워.

English (United States)(en-US): Without warning. Without... warning.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무방비하다. ... 무방비하다.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. Maybe, without warning, I’ve been\nshattered into pieces right now.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래, 어쩌면 나는 지금 무방비하게\n부서져 버린 것일지도 모르겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): I saw ‘it’.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘그것’을 봐 버렸거든.

English (United States)(en-US): It?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그것?

English (United States)(en-US): ... The coin.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 동전의 뒷면.

English (United States)(en-US): Or rather, the other side of it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 동전의 뒷면을 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Guess what was on it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 동전의 뒷면엔 무엇이 놓여 있었게?

English (United States)(en-US): .... What?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 동전의 뒷면? 뭐가 놓여 있었는데?

English (United States)(en-US): N o t h i n g.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아 무 것 도 없 었 어.

English (United States)(en-US): J u s t n o t h i n g.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아 무 것 도.

English (United States)(en-US): It was too hollow to be silence,\nbut too unreal to be a void.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 침묵이라 부르기엔 공허했고,\n공백이라 부르기엔 비현실적이었어.

English (United States)(en-US): All the simple, yet bright things\nthat embroidered that coin...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 동전의 앞면을 찬란하고 소박하게 수놓던 모든 것들...

English (United States)(en-US): Music, parties, flashes of light.\nHer lovely red steps on the dance floor.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가령 음악, 파티, 섬광, 춤.\n그녀의 빨갛고 사랑스런 발걸음.

English (United States)(en-US): Things full, soft, thrumming with life.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가득 찬 것들, 부드러운 것들, 박동하는 것들.

English (United States)(en-US): The smell of the outdoors on her coat.\nA silly argument with her best friend Andie.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 외투에 묻은 바깥 냄새. ‘진로에 대한 고민’?\n단짝이었던 앤디와의 바보 같은 말다툼까지.

English (United States)(en-US): All of it, futile.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 전부 소용이 없었어.

English (United States)(en-US): Everything on the surface
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모든 앞면의 것들은

English (United States)(en-US): vanished as soon as the coin flipped.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 동전이 뒤집힘과 동시에 흔적도 없이 사라졌고.

English (United States)(en-US): And nothing. was left behind.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아무것도. 남아 있지 않았어.

English (United States)(en-US): Death is irreversible like that.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ...... 그렇게 손 쓸 수 없는 것이 바로 죽음이지.

English (United States)(en-US): Once you cross the line that separates\nit from life, you don’t come back.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 건너가면 영원히 붙잡을 수도, 돌아올 수도 없는 삶의 경계이자,

English (United States)(en-US): A cliff’s edge. A yawning abyss.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 낭떠러지. 압도적인 심연.

English (United States)(en-US): (What do I do? I don’t know\nhow to talk Dot down.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (어쩌지? 뭐라 말해야 뭉치를\n진정시킬 수 있을지 모르겠어.)

English (United States)(en-US): I learned about ‘suicide’ on the Moon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달나라에 있을 때 ‘자살’에 대해 배웠어.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s when a nightmare torments a human\nso much... that they take their own life.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 아주 끔찍한 악몽에 시달리던 인간이...\n자신의 손으로 목숨을 끊어 내는 비극.

English (United States)(en-US): But I had no idea you humans\ncould die for reasons beyond that.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 소중한 인간이 자살 외의 이유로도\n죽을 수 있다는 건 꿈에도 몰랐어.

English (United States)(en-US): You only knew a fraction of what death is.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음에 대한 극히 일부만을 알고 있었구나.

English (United States)(en-US): ....... But one thing consoles me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ....... 그래도 위안 삼을 수 있는 게 있다면.

English (United States)(en-US): ...... At least you’ll be safe from that\nbarren abyss. So will you reassure me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ...... 너만은 이 척박한 심연으로부터 안전할 수\n있다는 것. 그러니 어서 나에게 확신을 줄래?

English (United States)(en-US): Of what?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응? 무슨 확신?

English (United States)(en-US): Death...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음이란 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s like a misplaced trap\nthat snaps away a life, right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잘못 놓인 덫 하나가 한순간에\n목숨을 앗아가 버리는 것이지?

English (United States)(en-US): So the human that draws the short end\nof the stick... is roughly one in a hundred?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 무작위 추첨으로 죽게 되는 불운한\n인간은... 대략 백 명 중 한 명 정도인 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): I made sure to count. There were\nmaybe a hundred people at the party.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 똑똑히 세어 보았거든.\n그 파티에 있는 사람은 백 명 정도였고.

English (United States)(en-US): And only one’s fate was\nflipped by that lucky coin.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘행운의 동전’이 뒤집은 운명은 오직 한 명뿐이었거든.

English (United States)(en-US): So <nickname>. You’re one of the\nninety-nine that will never die. Right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 <nickname>, 너는, 너는... 절대 죽지 않는\n아흔아홉 명 중 한 명에 속하는 게 맞는 거지?

English (United States)(en-US): Huh? Wait, Dot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어? 잠깐만, 뭉치야.

English (United States)(en-US): (Oh no... Dot’s got it all wrong.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭔가를 단단히 오해하고 있는 것 같아...)

English (United States)(en-US): Death isn’t a game of straws.|Death isn’t a lottery of misfortune.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음은 확률 게임 같은 게 아니야.|죽음은 불운한 복권 같은 게 아니야.

English (United States)(en-US): What?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭐?

English (United States)(en-US): Then what is human death\nas you understand it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇다면 인간의 죽음이란... 어떤 건데?

English (United States)(en-US): It’s sad... but all humans die.|Death. We’re fated for it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 슬프지만... 모든 인간은 죽어.|죽음. 반드시 찾아오는 운명이지.

English (United States)(en-US): Accidents, illnesses, or simply old age.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 손을 쓸 수 없는 사고를 당한다거나, 돌이킬 수\n없는 병에 걸린다거나, 단지 수명을 다한다거나.

English (United States)(en-US): The causes vary. But eventually\nwe’ll all turn to dust six feet under.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 방식은 다양하지만 우리는 모두 언젠가\n백골이 되어 땅에 스며들게 될 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Of course, I’m no exception.|It’s scary... but so will I.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 인간에게도 예외는 없어.|두렵지만... 나에게도 일어날 일이고.

English (United States)(en-US): What?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭐?

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Is this true?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말이야?

English (United States)(en-US): Think it over. It can’t be, right? Think of\ndeath as, say, a party in the underworld.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잘 생각해 봐. 그렇지는 않을걸? 죽음이 오늘의\n파티처럼, 그래, 암흑 왕의 축제라고 생각해 보자.

English (United States)(en-US): Can’t you be pardoned from it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너에게 주어진 면제권 같은 건 없어?

English (United States)(en-US): Fate won’t grant me that\nkind of special treatment.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 운명에게 그 정도까지 특별 대우를 받는 사람은 아니야.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m just another human being\nthat happens to be your friend.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그저 너와 친구가 된, 몇십억 명 중 하나의 인간일 뿐인 걸.

English (United States)(en-US): You’re lying.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 거짓말이지?

English (United States)(en-US): I wish I were. I wish there was a way out... |You can see it in my eyes. I’m not lying.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 거짓말이면 좋겠어, 나도. 피할 길이 있었다면... |뭉치도 답을 알고 있잖아. 내 눈에 거짓이 없단 걸.

English (United States)(en-US): Ah.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 으으.

English (United States)(en-US): Ah... I’m sorry...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 으으... 미안해...

English (United States)(en-US): But it’s hard to accept it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 받아들이기 힘들어.

English (United States)(en-US): Even you, my beloved human,\nare walking towards death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 사랑스러운 인간인 너마저\n죽음을 향해 걷는 존재였다니.

English (United States)(en-US): How do you bear it when the\nhorror of death grips you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음에 대한 공포에 사로잡힐 때면,\n너는 대체 어떻게 견딜 수 있었어?

English (United States)(en-US): The pain of existential terror\nmy wise friend must have suffered...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지혜로운 네가 겪었을, 존재의\n불안에 대한 고통을 떠올리면...

English (United States)(en-US): Well, it’s hard to put into words...\nbut we don’t live in constant fear.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 한마디로 설명하긴 어렵지만... 우리가 계속 두려워하며 살아가진 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): More often than not we just\ndon’t acknowledge death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 평상시에 죽음을 인지하지 않거나, 완전히 배제하고 살아갈 때가 많거든.

English (United States)(en-US): If we gazed into death all the time...\nlife would be intolerable.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음을 항상 들여다보고 있으면...\n도무지 살아갈 수가 없을 테니까.

English (United States)(en-US): For death stands in opposition to life.\nA brutal end that takes away everything.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음은 삶과 대척되는 지점에서, 삶이었던 모든\n것을 끝내 거두어 버리는 포악한 ‘끝’이니까.

English (United States)(en-US): I can’t say I agree... but sure.|Yes, that’s exactly it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 동의하는지는 모르겠지만... 일단은.|그래, 동의하지 않을 수가 없네.

English (United States)(en-US): Sometimes late at night when I’m thinking,\nor when I hear about an accident...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다만 밤에 누워서 공상에 잠길 때나,\n누군가의 갑작스러운 사고 소식을 접했을 때라면...

English (United States)(en-US): Then death scares me.\nIt terrifies me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음에 대한 생각에 빠지기도 하지.

English (United States)(en-US): Especially late at night when I’m thinking,\nor when I hear about an accident...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 특히 밤에 누워서 공상에 잠길 때나,\n누군가의 갑작스러운 사고 소식을 접했을 때라면...

English (United States)(en-US): That gets me thinking about death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음에 대한 생각에 빠지기도 하지.

English (United States)(en-US): And the thing is...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 실은...

English (United States)(en-US): The thought of death terrifies me.|I’m not afraid of death. Not at all.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 언젠가 죽게 될 거란 사실이 무섭고 끔찍해.|난 죽음이 하나도 무섭지 않다?

English (United States)(en-US): Sometimes that fear paralyzes me.|I’ve grown used to the concept.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음의 공포가 찾아오면 뜬눈으로 얼어붙기도 하지.|죽음의 개념에 익숙해지면서 그 공포가 완화되었을 뿐.

English (United States)(en-US): I can’t imagine what it would feel like. Or rather, what it would feel like not to feel.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽어 있다는 감각은 무엇일지 상상할 수조차 없잖아. 아니, 감각조차 하지 못하는 상태에 있다는 건 뭘까?

English (United States)(en-US): How unfathomable it must be.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 얼마나 까마득할까?

English (United States)(en-US): When I try to contemplate it my breath stops. Guess\nit’s a human thing, regardless of how old you are.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 여전히 그 아득함을 가늠해 보려 할 때마다 숨이 멈칫해.\n아무리 어른일지라도, ‘인간’이라면 다 비슷할 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Death is a mystery. What an adventure it must be.|Death means no more pain. Like falling asleep.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음은 미지의 영역이잖아. 마치 여행처럼 느껴질 것 같아.|죽으면 모든 고통도 끝나는 거잖아. 평화로운 잠처럼 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): But I guess... on my death bed,\nthe fear might catch up with me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 어쩌면... 나 역시도 죽게 되는 그 순간만큼은\n본능적인 두려움에 휩싸일지도 모르지.

English (United States)(en-US): It will be the first step into a space of\n“nothingness,” one I’ve never experienced.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 한 번도 경험해 보지 못한 ‘무’로\n내딛는 첫 발걸음일 테니까.
... 이럴 수가.

English (United States)(en-US): You really are running toward death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너, 정말 죽음을 향해 달려가고 있는 거구나?

English (United States)(en-US): Did you really think someone\ncould cheat death?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말 누군간 죽음을 피해 갈 수\n있으리라고 여겼던 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes... and I so wanted it to be you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응... 그리고 그게 너이길 간절히 바랐어.

English (United States)(en-US): No, I was certain it would be you!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니, 그러지 않을 리가 없다고 생각했어!

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>. I truly had no idea\nwhat you were going through!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그야 말이지, <nickname>. 네가 그런 무서운\n일을 겪고 있다곤 상상조차 못했어!

English (United States)(en-US): You know for certain death is coming,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 무조건 죽는다는 걸 알고 있다면,

English (United States)(en-US): and that it’s only a matter\nof where and when.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 단지 ‘때와 장소’의\n문제일 뿐이란 사실이 널 매 분 매 초 옥죄고 있다면

English (United States)(en-US): How are you not crawling on the floor,\nfrightened out of your mind?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 어떻게 겁에 질려 바닥을\n기면서 살아가지 않는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Every step you take must feel as if\nyou are about to fall into a sinkhole.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 매순간 떼는 발걸음이 싱크 홀을\n눈앞에 둔 것만 같은 기분이지 않겠어?

English (United States)(en-US): (The sudden return of existential terror is choking.)|(... Dot doesn’t seem to be coping well.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (별안간 잊고 있던 죽음의 공포가 물밀듯 숨을 옥죄어 온다.)|(... 뭉치가 걱정돼. 여전히 충격에서 헤어나오지 못한 것 같다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Wait.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잠시만.
잠시만...

English (United States)(en-US): I think we should take a break.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리, 잠깐 쉬었다 가는 게 좋겠지?

English (United States)(en-US): ... Okay.
I’ve pushed you too far.\nI’m sorry, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 너를 너무 몰아붙였나 봐. 미안해, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Coping with your mortality\nmust be hard enough already...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 필멸하는 삶을 견뎌 내는 것만으로도\n충분히 버거울 텐데...

English (United States)(en-US): Wait.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잠시만.

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잠시만...

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe we should take a break.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리, 잠깐 쉬었다 가는 게 좋겠지?

English (United States)(en-US): ... Alright.
I’m making a fuss when it’s you who\nneeds to cope with mortality. ... I’m sorry.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 더 소란을 피우고 있네. 필멸하는\n삶을 견뎌 내야 것은 너일 텐데도... 미안해.

English (United States)(en-US): I only...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 단지...

English (United States)(en-US): Nothing. I think we both\nneed to catch our breath.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니야. 이제 정말 숨을 고르고 쉬어야 할 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll call for you after a while.\nHopefully we’ll both be stable...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 시간이 지나면 다시 너를 부를게.\n부디 우리가 평화를 되찾은 상태이길...

English (United States)(en-US): You’ve come back, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 돌아와 주었구나, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ve been thinking about you humans,\nand you in particular. My dear friend.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 줄곧 너희 인간 종족에 대해, 그리고 나의 소중한 인간\n친구인 <nickname>, 너에 대해 생각하고 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): First, I want to tell you what I couldn’t before.\nI don’t know when I’ll get another chance.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우선, 아까 미처 하지 못했던 말을 전해 주려 해.\n지금 하지 않으면... 또 언제 하게 될 수 있을지 모르니까.

English (United States)(en-US): This feels ominous. What is it?|I’ve been meaning to ask. Talk to me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 괜히 불안해지네. 어떤 이야기를 하려 했었어?|안 그래도 궁금했는데. 응, 이야기해 줘.

English (United States)(en-US): You are special. Truly exquisite.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말로. 너는 정말로. 무척이나 특별한 존재야.

English (United States)(en-US): You walk toward death, but you embrace the\nfleeting nature of life and choose to live.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음을 향해 걸어가는 예비-사체이면서도,\n그 덧없음을 받아들이고 살아가는 쪽을 고르지.

English (United States)(en-US): Even when you think you haven’t chosen.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 고르지 않았다고 생각할 때조차 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): You share your home with a monster friend,\nspend hours chatting to it...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 너는 불시착한 괴물 친구에게 너의 보금자리\n일부를 내어 주고, 그와 함께 담소를 나누며...

English (United States)(en-US): and sit by the moonlit window\nand gaze at the night sky.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달빛이 가닿은 창가에 앉아 밤하늘을 바라봐.

English (United States)(en-US): Even when you know all roads lead to death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 결국 모든 게 죽음으로서 끝나게 된다는 걸 알고 있으면서도 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): (Not that I’ve made any plans yet......)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (아직은 죽을 예정이 없지만......)

English (United States)(en-US): It truly is beautiful.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 정말로 아름다운 일이야.

English (United States)(en-US): So even if you... y-you, die...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이건 네가 죽더라도... 죽, 죽게 되더라도...

English (United States)(en-US): (I’m being comforted by an alien monster.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (인외 괴물에게서 받는 존재론적인 위로인 셈이구나.)

English (United States)(en-US): (How heartwarming...)|(How unexpected.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (마음이 뭉클해지고 있어...)|(다소 당황스럽다.)

English (United States)(en-US): I won’t...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 절대...

English (United States)(en-US): I won’t......
Oh dear.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이런.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh... dear.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오... 이런.

English (United States)(en-US): ... Dot?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 뭉치야?

English (United States)(en-US): It’s too soon for me to comfort\nyou. I’m not ready yet.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 역시 널 위로해 주기엔 너무 일렀던 거야.\n내가 준비되지 않았어.

English (United States)(en-US): The fact that you’ll die.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 죽게 될 거란 사실을

English (United States)(en-US): That even you will die...\nI can’t accept it just yet.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘너도’ 죽게 될 거란 사실을...\n나는 차마 받아들일 수 없나 봐.

English (United States)(en-US): ... But I’m still here.|... But that might not happen for a long time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 그치만, 나는 아직 살아 있는 걸?|... 그치만, 죽음은 한참이나 먼 얘기 같은 걸?

English (United States)(en-US): You are. For now.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아직은. 살아 있지만.

English (United States)(en-US): It is. For now.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 당장은. 그렇게 느껴지겠지만.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>...

English (United States)(en-US): What if your side of the coin that I loved so,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 사랑해 마지않았던 너의 동전 앞면이

English (United States)(en-US): were to flip without any kind of warning?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떠한 예고도 없이 까마득하게 뒤집혀 버린다면?

English (United States)(en-US): I know. I know what’s coming.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래, 나는 이 질문에 대한 답을 이미 알고 있지.

English (United States)(en-US): ‘It’s fixed. A coin flipped can’t be reversed.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘어찌할 수 없다. 뒤집힌 동전은 불가역적이다.’

English (United States)(en-US): But this is your death we’re talking about.\nIt’s you, the human I love more than anyone.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 다른 누구도 아닌 너의 죽음이야.\n내가 가장 애착하는 인간인 <nickname>, 너의 죽음.

English (United States)(en-US): What about all the times we spent together?\nWhere do those hours go?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지금까지 너와 내가 쌓아둔 수많은 시간들은\n어떻게 되는 거야? 어디로 가는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Do you and I cease just like that?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너와 나는 그대로 끊겨 버리는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Those chats, shared looks and warmth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너와 즐겁게 대화하고, 눈빛과 손길을 주고받고,

English (United States)(en-US): And future ‘maybes,’ where you and I would enjoy\ncool moonlight. Will they be gone forever?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 함께 달빛의 시원함을 느낄 수 있던 미래의\n‘만약에’들도 영영 되돌아오지 못하는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): It’s sad... but yes. Gone forever.|(How do I break this to them...)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 애석하지만... 응, 되돌아오지 않을 거야.|(차마 확답할 수 없어. 어떻게 이야기해야 좋을까...)

English (United States)(en-US): Dot... my death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야... 내가 죽는다는 건.

English (United States)(en-US): 가늠하기 아득할 만큼 무서운 일이지만.|I can’t run from it no matter what.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가늠하기 아득할 만큼 무서운 일이지만.|아무리 애써도 피할 수 없는 일이지만.

English (United States)(en-US): But all living things die.\nAnd like I said, I’m no exception.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 살아 있던 건 모두 죽어. 아까도\n이야기했듯이, 나 역시 그 예외가 아니야.

English (United States)(en-US): ... I get it now.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 이젠 그걸 이해할 수 있지.

English (United States)(en-US): Everyone in the universe has their allotted death,\nand yours will come for you one day.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 우주 속 모두가 하나씩 나눠 가진\n죽음은 분명 너에게도 찾아올 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): As it came for stars and galaxies, for tens of billions\nof wonderful humans and creatures big and little.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 별과 은하에게도, 수백억 명의 아름다운\n인간들과 크고 작은 생물들에게도 그러했듯이.

English (United States)(en-US): It will be sudden, if not surprising.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 갑작스럽지만, 마땅히 놀랍지는 않은 일이지.

English (United States)(en-US): But the laws of death that\nthe world has established.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 이 세계가 죽음에 대해 정립해 온 모든 법칙들은

English (United States)(en-US): They’ll lose all objectivity once you truly die.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 ‘정말로’ 죽게 되는 순간 모든 객관성을 잃어버릴 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): And... it will be an unfathomably unique tragedy.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고... 터무니없이 개인적인 비극이 될 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Death... is the one true end that\nwill take you away from me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음은... 우주에서 단 하나뿐인 너를,\n나에게서 영영 앗아갈 진짜 ‘끝’이니까.

English (United States)(en-US): And.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게.

English (United States)(en-US): ... I will crumble.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 난 무너지겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): With you no longer there to help me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나를 도와줄 유일한 존재인 너조차 죽고 없어진 채.

English (United States)(en-US): I will crumble all alone.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 홀로 무너지고야 말 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): To overcome the death of a loved one...\nit’s truly hard.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사랑하는 존재의 죽음을 지나오는 일은...\n그래, 정말 어려운 일이야.

English (United States)(en-US): All you can do is cope.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 견디는 것 말고는 뾰족한 선택지가 없으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): But your life will still go on.|But you can still imagine what comes after death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 그럼에도 너의 삶은 계속되는걸.|하지만 죽음 너머를 상상하는 일이 무의미한 건 아니야.

English (United States)(en-US): The days might feel emptier than when I was by\nour side, and sometimes regret will seize you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 너의 곁에 있었을 때보단 공허한 하루하루가\n이어지고, 때로는 후회에 젖어들기도 할 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): All the words left unsaid or spoken too soon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그때 그 말을 했더라면, 혹은 하지 않았더라면.

English (United States)(en-US): ... The days I never got.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 오늘까지도 살아 있었더라면.

English (United States)(en-US): But that hollowness and sadness will lessen.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 그 공허함과 슬픔은 점차 무뎌질 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): As time passes you’ll find your own way of\ndealing with the loss, or meet a new human friend.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 시간이 흘러 상실감을 다루는 너만의 방법을 찾게 될 수도, \n새로운 인간 친구를 만나게 될 수도 있겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): So when that day comes... I want you to keep\ngoing, even if the path ahead is unclear.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 뭉치도 그날이 오게 되면... 아무것도 보이지\n않을지라도 그저 앞으로 나아가 봤으면 좋겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): Keep going, even if the path is unclear...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아무것도 보이지 않을지라도, 그저 앞으로...

English (United States)(en-US): You can imagine me in the wind,\nor as a bird watching over you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치는 내가 바람이 되어, 혹은 새가 되어\n너를 지켜보고 있을 거라고 믿을 수도 있을 테고,

English (United States)(en-US): You can picture my soul floating through\nspace and travelling between planets.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽고 나서 우주를 떠다니며 행성 간 여행을 하고 있을\n나의 영혼을 상상해 볼 수 있을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): It doesn’t matter if it’s real or not.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 진짜인지 아닌지는 중요하지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): Loving and reminiscing someone can\ngive you the strength to live on.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 누군가를 사랑하고 기억하는 마음은 현재를\n더 힘차게 살아갈 힘이 되어 주기도 하거든.

English (United States)(en-US): ... Love stays, even when they’re gone.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 더는 옆에 없을지라도, 그게\n사랑이란 사실이 변하진 않으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): So imagine... and believe in love?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 상상과... 사랑의 힘을 믿으란 말인 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, it’s not just humans.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 인간들만 그런 게 아니었어.

English (United States)(en-US): How could I have forgotten?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜 잊고 있었을까?

English (United States)(en-US): The Moon Beings... Red, Edison and Sir Cello.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달 뒤편의 이들... 레드, 에디슨과 첼로 경을.

English (United States)(en-US): They survived their losses as well.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들도 상실을 살아남은 존재들이었어.

English (United States)(en-US): Their beloved humans chose\nto cross into the abyss of death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사랑하는 인간이 죽음의 심연 너머로\n자진해서 걸어들어가는 모습을

English (United States)(en-US): And all they could do was watch.\nThere was nothing they could do.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들은 그저 바라봐야만 했어.\n아무것도 할 수 없이. 아무것도.

English (United States)(en-US): (I had no idea. The Moon... and all that hurt.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (그동안 상상조차 할 수 없었어.\n달에는 그런... 그런 아픔이 있었구나.)

English (United States)(en-US): ... They weren’t even allowed\nto make human dreams.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 더는 인간의 꿈을 만들지도 못하게 되었지.

English (United States)(en-US): But still, they rake through the filth\nunder the factory every day.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼에도 그들은, 공장 아래에서 하루도\n빠짐없이 갈퀴를 든 채 꿈 폐기물을 긁어 내.

English (United States)(en-US): They chase off the moon moths,\nsing, and observe the meteorites.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달나방들을 좇으며 노래를 부르고,\n달의 운석들을 연구하며 눈을 빛내.

English (United States)(en-US): ... Red,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 레드는,

English (United States)(en-US): Red.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드는.

English (United States)(en-US): He believes his human is traveling\nthe warmest corner of the universe.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 자신의 인간이 지금은 우주의 가장\n따뜻한 구석을 여행하고 있으리라 굳게 믿어.

English (United States)(en-US): And he never stops burning.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 자신의 몸을 불사르며 타오르길 멈추지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): Why not?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜 타오르길 멈추지 않는데?

English (United States)(en-US): Because he dreams of the day he’ll meet his\nhuman again...and use his flames to warm him up.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 언젠가 그의 인간을 다시 만나는 날이 오면...\n그를 따뜻하게 데워 주고 싶다는 꿈을 꾸거든.

English (United States)(en-US): The Moon Beings are strong.\nThey may have despaired every day,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달의 이들은 강인하구나. 모든 것이\n절망적인 하루하루였을지라도,

English (United States)(en-US): yet they discovered you, and\nsent you to Earth with their hopes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 너를 발견하고, 또 다시\n희망을 품은 채 지구로 날려 보냈잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes... Inspite of everything.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응... 그 모든 일이 있었음에도.

English (United States)(en-US): When Red drew my chalk eyes
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드가 나에게 분필 눈을 그려 주었을 때

English (United States)(en-US): the first thing I saw in this world...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 세상에 태어나 처음 마주 보았던 건...

English (United States)(en-US): were his eyes, brave and curious.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드의 용감하고 호기심 어린 눈이었어.

English (United States)(en-US): That part of Red will always be a part of me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 일부는 언제까지나 레드의 일부일 테야.

English (United States)(en-US): So when the day comes... just like Red, I’ll...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 그날이 오게 되면, 나도... 레드처럼...

English (United States)(en-US): (The Moon Beings must mean a lot to Dot.)|(It makes me curious about the Moon Beings.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (달의 이들은 뭉치에게 정말 소중한 존재구나.)|(한 번도 만난 적 없는 달의 이들이 궁금해져.)

English (United States)(en-US): (Maybe we could have been friends too?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (우리도 친구가 될 수 있었을까?)

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll probably never accept\nyour death, not completely.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아마 나는 너의 소멸을 결코 온전히 받아들일 수 없을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll perch my black body on the moonlit window,\nand talk even when my words won’t reach you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 검은 몸을 이끌고 달 뜬 창가에 앉아,\n닿지 않는 너에게 말을 걸겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): About the humans I saw that day, and the\npeculiar thoughts I had the night before.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘 보고 온 인간에 대해, 간밤 들었던\n기묘한 생각들에 대해.

English (United States)(en-US): And it will hurt to remember you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 삶을 기억하는 일은 아마 계속 아프겠지만

English (United States)(en-US): But I’ll bear that hurt.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래도 그 고통은 내가 감당할 몫일 테고

English (United States)(en-US): And when your loss weighs\nheavier than my black,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너를 잃은 슬픔이 나의 검정보다도 무겁게 젖어들 때면

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll recall the quiet footsteps\nthat crossed the Moon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달의 뒤편을 수놓던 그들의 적막한 발걸음을 떠올릴 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): And I’ll find courage from them...\nthat I couldn’t have on my own.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 나 혼자만으론 낼 수 없었던\n용기를... 낼 수 있을 것만 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Now let’s say goodbye, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제 인사를 하자, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): We’ll say it today, tomorrow, and the day after.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 오늘도, 내일도, 그 모레도\n인사를 나누기로 약속하는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): “See you, <nickname>!”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “그럼 다녀와, <nickname>!”

English (United States)(en-US): And you’ll say, “Yeah, see you.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “그래, 다녀올게.” 하고.

English (United States)(en-US): We’ll believe that tomorrow we’ll come,\nbecause of course it will.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 온 마음 다해 너와의 내일이 존재할 것이라고,\n존재하지 않을 이유가 없다고.

English (United States)(en-US): And so we’ll feel relief, and have faith.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 함부로 안심하고, 무작정 믿어 보는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): So... see you, <nickname>. Okay?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼... 다녀와, <nickname>. 알았지?

English (United States)(en-US): ...... Okay, Dot. Yeah.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ...... 응, 뭉치야. 알았어.

English (United States)(en-US): See you soon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 금방 다녀올게.
